description: Illustrate two vectors u and v in a plane, and their sum u+v, showing all three vectors originating from the origin and remaining within the plane, demonstrating closure under addition.
Show two vectors u and v. Illustrate u+v using the parallelogram rule, and then v+u also using the parallelogram rule, demonstrating that both result in the same diagonal vector.

Illustrate three vectors u, v, and w. Show the sum (u+v) first, then add w to it. Separately, show the sum (v+w) first, then add u to it. Demonstrate that the final resultant vector is the same in both cases.
Show a vector u and the zero vector 0. Illustrate u+0=u, where 0 is a point at the origin.
Show a vector u and its additive inverse -u (same magnitude, opposite direction). Illustrate their sum resulting in the zero vector at the origin.
Illustrate a vector u and a scalar c. Show the scaled vector c*u, which lies on the same line as u but with scaled length, demonstrating closure under scalar multiplication.
Show vectors u and v, and their sum u+v. Then show c(u+v). Separately, show cu and cv, and their sum cu+cv. Demonstrate that the final vectors are identical.
Show a vector u and scalars c and d. Illustrate (c+d)u. Separately, show cu and du, and their sum cu+du. Demonstrate that the final vectors are identical.
Show a vector u and scalars c and d. Illustrate du first, then c(du). Separately, calculate the scalar product (cd) and then show (cd)u. Demonstrate that the final vectors are identical.
Show a vector u. Illustrate that multiplying u by the scalar 1 results in the same vector u.
